alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 321 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near La Cueva, or 9 miles southeast of Mora, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Valmora, La Cueva, Watrous, Ojo Feliz, Golondrinas, Luceros, Rainsville and Shoemaker. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 352 and 380. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 4 and 6. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 17 and 18. State Road 434 near Mile Marker 0. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 13 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
